intro: Micropus longifolius, commonly known as the longleaf micropus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
